thread.title: The (Right) Envelope, Please: PwC Plans for an Uneventful Oscars

author: Michael Rapoport
title: The (Right) Envelope, Please: PwC Plans for an Uneventful Oscars
text:
No matter which movie wins best picture at Sunday’s Academy Awards, PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP is determined that this year’s show ends with less unscripted drama than 2017’s.

The accounting giant and its predecessor firms have tabulated Oscar votes and acted as keeper of the winners’ names for more than 80 years. But because of PwC, last year’s ceremony concluded with the gaffe seen ‘round the world: “La La Land” was announced as the winner of best picture, instead of the actual winner, “Moonlight,” after a PwC partner gave... RELATED VIDEO 'Moonlight' Beats 'La La Land' in a Steve Harvey Moment In a dramatic turn of events, “Moonlight” won best picture at the 2017 Oscars after the award was initially given to favorite “La La Land.” The romantic musical, this year’s expected big winner, won six out of 14 nominations. Pictured: “Moonlight” producers Jeremy Kleiner and Adele Romanski, and director Barry Jenkins, Photo: Reuters (Originally published Feb. 27, 2017)
